title: Bounded context first
summary: Define domain boundaries and ownership before designing integration flows.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Without boundaries, integration becomes a shared dumping ground and recreates broker-style coupling.
whenNotToUse: A single team owns the full flow end-to-end and will remain so

gotchas: Boundaries defined on org charts instead of business capabilities
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Use business capabilities to define boundaries; enforce contracts between contexts.

complexity.rationale: Boundary definition drives sequencing and team structure.
complexity.skillDemand: Domain modeling and architecture facilitation skill.

realWorldExample.approach: Established 6–9 contexts and made contracts explicit.
